revised_title: Forests, Weather, and Climate: Deposition of Atmospheric Pollutants on Forests
tldr: This article examines the processes of deposition of atmospheric pollutants, such as particles, cloud droplets, and gaseous pollutants, onto forest canopies. It discusses the efficiency of forests as sinks for atmospheric pollutants and compares them with shorter vegetation. The study also highlights the influence of afforestation on pollutant deposition, using a specific case of Kielder Forest in northern Britain.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Forest Ecology
